docs.lead_paragraph: A new study indicates that the first National Alcohol Screening Day, observed four years ago at hundreds of sites nationwide, has been characterized a success, both in terms of attendance and results. More than 32,000 people attended the event in 1999, and two-thirds of a sample of participants surveyed later said they had quit drinking or cut back as a result.
docs.abstract: Dr Shelly F Greenfield, McLean Hospital (Belmont, Mass) researcher, publishes study in American Journal of Psychiatry that shows National Alcohol Screening Day, observed four years ago, had positive effect on many participants; out of 32,000 people who attended, two-thirds of those surveyed reported they had either quit drinking or cutback as result; cartoon (S)
